snippet: The ruling on the National Security Agency’s phone records program has given Larry Klayman, a plaintiff who is no stranger to lawsuits against the government, plenty to crow about.
abstract: Ruling on National Security Agency’s phone records program gives Larry Klayman, plaintiff who is no stranger to lawsuits against government, plenty to crow about; federal judge agrees with contention that NSA had exceeded its constitutional authority by systematically gathering telephone records of Americans.
lead_paragraph: The ruling on the National Security Agency’s phone records program has given Larry Klayman, a plaintiff who is no stranger to lawsuits against the government, plenty to crow about.

headline.seo: Larry Klayman, Plaintiff in N.S.A. Case, Savors Victory
headline.main: Score One for Thorn in Government’s Side Behind N.S.A. Ruling
headline.print_headline: Score One for Thorn in Government’s Side Behind N.S.A. Ruling
